article_title: Former Mexicana Airline Owner Said to Seek Asylum in U.S.
article_text:
MEXICO CITY—The former owner of bankrupt airline Mexicana, who is wanted in Mexico in connection with the collapse of the country´s former flagship carrier, has requested political asylum in the U.S., Mexican authorities said Wednesday.

Gastón Azcárraga, the former chairman of hotel chain Grupo Posadas who led a group of investors in the purchase of the airline from the Mexican government in 2006, was called by U.S. authorities...
